title: Which pre reworked champion do you miss the most?
body: The one i miss the most is definitely Shen, he was so much fun the new Shen just doesn't do anything for me.

I miss {{champion:90}} and {{champion:101}}.

They turned Malz into a minion-centric champion and took away the part of Xerath's kit that made him feel really unique to me.

Xerath was BS before his rework.
All you needed to do is tag a fool with his stun and threaten if they engage, you'll dump entire damage on them in those 2 seconds and 100-0 them.
if they had no range, maybe, but xerath was much harder than some people make him appear to be
{{champion:90}} hes a stupid support now

Tbh the most I miss is {{champion:43}} before her rework. I miss healing allies and murdering the hell out of people with the carefully planed use of... Shields (R + E twice). Tbh she was pretty cool like she was and only need to change her W. Today? She's pretty much either OP on organized play, or a burden on solo play because of her horrendous decay late game (Pretty much near useless If you don't get enough AP to one shot of half-shot people away with R + Q), although her numbers are actually pretty high.

I also kinda miss {{champion:37}}  before her rework on patch 4.13 - although I remember distinctly about people bitching all day If i ever picked her on ranked. (You could Q so many times before people get bored, I guess.) DJ Sona didn't even exist back on those days soo... it isn't like I could complain too much, lol. At least she actually has a skill curve and You can distinguish good ones from really, really bad ones. The only thing I hate from her kit today is the Rank 1 Heal - 35 healing for 80 mana, weee. Kinda offset by the shield. She also seems to still not be used very much on LCS.

{{champion:44}} too... I dislike his ult at the moment. It's made pretty much for organized play and requires WAY too much timing, and I think it needs to be tweaked or changed to something else (Because, oh, you ult and the enemy team so easily runs away until it wears off). At least he no longer is a "ball of stats", but Shatter and Radiance were thematically cool. And OP, kinda. I used to go top with him xD. These days before, at least his Q actually healed something, rather than being dispersed over five allies.

{{champion:107}}  for sure. I feel like his rework made him less fun to play and less fun to play against. His slicey skillshot Q noise sounds much worse than the old one and his new w has been a mess. I'm not saying old rengar was perfect. In fact, he was far from it, but at least the person playing him had fun and he would go down if he mispositioned or he mistimed his approach. This version seems like a downgrade for the hunter and his victim. {{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
Graves... I used to main him ADC Until he hot reworked into a fucking jungler who can't even auto through minions

Also I really loved her old tether, it was a lot more interesting because you could use it on allies or enemies and speed allies up or slow enemies down while damaging people who get hit by the tether itself.

Oh and 2 mantra stacks kreygasm
Rip old Raka :(

{{champion:16}} and {{champion:44}} 

These were what I got so drawn to when I started playing League and getting the hang of MOBAs all together. And although they are still mains of mine, the flexibility I had with them (Mid and Top Soraka and omni-role Taric) is something I just shed a tear to never having again. In URF context, Soraka was one of those demon tier champs in pre rework. Raining MR shredding starcalls and self healing with armor buffing....and a point click silence. So beautiful but deserving to be reworked.
{{champion:98}} {{champion:8}} :I i was level 5 on both of them, then i got reworked. I cant stand playing either any more, especially Shen.

Old {{champion:8}} was one of my top 2 most played, I miss how smooth his old E felt to use. The damage and amount he healed for on his Q felt so much more consistent and significant, not like 2 semi-weak heals and then a strong heal.....assuming you even even get to 3rd Q something in his blood rush timing if there is no minion wave around...

I miss old Fiora!

Some say Fiora used to be just an ult with a pretty face, but at least she was fun to play.
The new one is a mess to me.

She gave me my first ever penta too.

_And people can't give grief about her old ultimate being overpowered, because that was exactly the same thing Master Yi still have._

Taric - I still main him but there is something not right with this rework both in terms of gameplay and lore.
Gameplay-wise old Taric was the closest thing we had to juggernaut-support and this playstyle was destroyed in his rework. Also his new ult is just booring and takes ~70% of his power budget.
In terms of lore he was moved to Targon and did nothig there. He have no connections to other aspects, aurelion sol or Targon's story.

But the worst thing is that he talks more about stars and mountain than gems.
